summary: This document is a chain of emails from January 2020 between prosecutors and a defense attorney, scheduling a meeting for the attorney to present proffer information on behalf of their client, Ms. [Redacted], regarding allegations against Jeffrey Epstein. The emails reveal the urgency from the prosecution's side to discuss potential charges and clarify details of an incident described in a complaint.

persons.name: Ms. [Redacted]
persons.context: The client of the defense attorney, whose recollection of an incident involving Jeffrey Epstein is sought by prosecutors. She is referenced as potentially observing Epstein engaged in sexual activity or other women/girls in sexually-suggestive circumstances.

persons.name: U.S. Attorney
persons.context: One of the ultimate decision-makers in the case, listed as expected to attend the scheduled proffer meeting with the defense attorney.

persons.name: Deputy U.S. Attorney
persons.context: One of the ultimate decision-makers in the case, listed as expected to attend the scheduled proffer meeting with the defense attorney.

persons.name: Chief of the Criminal Division
persons.context: One of the ultimate decision-makers in the case, listed as expected to attend the scheduled proffer meeting with the defense attorney.

persons.name: Chief Counsel
persons.context: Listed as a potential attendee at the scheduled proffer meeting with the defense attorney.

persons.name: Counsel
persons.context: Listed as a potential attendee at the scheduled proffer meeting with the defense attorney.

persons.name: Public Corruption Unit chiefs
persons.context: Listed as potential attendees at the scheduled proffer meeting with the defense attorney.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the case, referenced in relation to the incident described in the complaint and the sexual activity Ms. [Redacted] may have observed.

connections.description: Ms. [Redacted] is described as having potentially observed Epstein engaged in sexual activity or observed other women/girls in sexually-suggestive circumstances, implying a victim-witness relationship to his alleged actions.
The email chain is between prosecutors and a defense attorney who is representing Ms. [Redacted], scheduling a proffer meeting to convey her recollections.
The email chain shows scheduling and substantive discussions between the prosecution team and a defense attorney regarding a proffer meeting for the attorney's client.

events.title: Scheduled Proffer Meeting
events.description: A meeting scheduled for the defense attorney to present proffer information to the U.S. Attorney's office leadership regarding the case against Jeffrey Epstein and the recollections of Ms. [Redacted].

events.title: Prosecution Leadership Meeting
events.description: The prosecution office leadership met to discuss the status of the Epstein case and Ms. [Redacted] in particular, leading to the decision to schedule a proffer meeting with her attorney.

events.title: Complaint Submission
events.description: A complaint was originally sent on December 4, 2019, which included an incident description (specifically at page seven) that prosecutors are seeking clarification on from Ms. [Redacted].

keyFacts: In January 2020, prosecutors were urgently seeking to schedule a proffer meeting with a defense attorney representing a witness, Ms. [Redacted], regarding her recollections of Jeffrey Epstein.
The prosecution indicated a 'strong view that there are offenses that can be charged now' against Epstein, preferring to have the proffer conversation before charges were filed.

The subject of the proffer included Ms. [Redacted]'s recollection of a specific incident described in a December 4, 2019 complaint, as well as any other instances where she observed Epstein engaged in sexual activity or observed other women/girls in sexually-suggestive circumstances.
The planned meeting was to include high-level prosecutors such as the U.S. Attorney, Deputy U.S. Attorney, Chief of the Criminal Division, and FBI personnel, indicating the case's significance.
The email chain shows extensive redaction of names (both sender/recipient and the client's name), highlighting the sensitive and confidential nature of the discussions.
